ACQUIRED TASTE.Defintion: something that you may not like at first, but begin to like after you have tried it

ALLUDES.Defintion: to mention someone or something in a brief or indirect way

AMUSEMENT.Defintion: the feeling of being entertained or made to laugh

ASPECT.Defintion: one part of a situation, problem, subject, etc.

ASPECTS.Defintion: one part of a situation, problem, subject, etc.

BIASED.Defintion: showing an unreasonable like or dislike for a person based on personal opinions

COMPONENT.Defintion: a part that combines with other parts to form something bigger

CONVEY.Defintion: to express a thought, feeling, or idea so that it is understood by other people

DARE I SAY IT.Defintion: used to say that you agree or think that something is true

DEADPAN DELIVERY.Defintion: looking or seeming serious when you are telling a joke

DOUBLE-ENTENDRE.Defintion: a word or phrase that might be understood in two ways, one of which is usually sexual

ELABORATE.Defintion: containing a lot of careful detail or many detailed parts

ENCOUNTER.Defintion: a meeting, especially one that happens by chance

INNUENDO.Defintion: (the making of) a remark or remarks that suggest something sexual or something unpleasant but do not refer to it directly

IRONY.Defintion: a situation in which something which was intended to have a particular result has the opposite or a very different result

LAUGHTER TRACK.Defintion: a separate soundtrack for a recorded comedy show containing the sound of audience laughter

MOCK.Defintion: to laugh at someone, often by copying them in a funny but unkind way

MONOTONY.Defintion: a situation in which something stays the same and is therefore boring

MUNDANE.Defintion: very ordinary and therefore not interesting

OFF-LIMITS.Defintion: If an area of land is off-limits, you are not allowed to enter it

ON SCREEN.Defintion: used to refer to something or someone seen or appearing on a television or computer screen

QUINTESSENTIALLY.Defintion: in a way that is the most typical example or most important part of something

SELF-DEPRECATION.Defintion: the quality of trying to make yourself, your abilities, or your achievements seem less important

SHIPWRECKED.Defintion: an accident in which a ship is destroyed or sunk at sea, especially by hitting rocks, or a ship that has been destroyed or sunk in such an accident

SHY.Defintion: nervous and uncomfortable with other people

STEREOTYPE.Defintion: a set idea that people have about what someone or something is like, especially an idea that is wrong

STEREOTYPES.Defintion: a set idea that people have about what someone or something is like, especially an idea that is wrong

STEREOTYPICAL.Defintion: relating to a set idea that people have about what someone or something is like, especially an idea that is wrong

STORYLINES.Defintion: (in a book, film, play, etc.) the plot (= the series of events that happen in it)

STRAIGHT FACE.Defintion: a serious expression on your face that you use when you do not want someone to know that you think something is funny

TABOO.Defintion: a subject, word, or action that is avoided for religious or social reasons

TRAITS.Defintion: a particular characteristic that can produce a particular type of behaviour

VITAL.Defintion: necessary for the success or continued existence of something; extremely important
